titleInfo.title: Matschiner et al v. Lewis et al

name.namePart: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: Matschiner et al v. Lewis et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Pending before the court are motions for summary judgment by the plaintiffs 20 and by the Hartford defendants 23. Mr. Lewis requested time to file his motion for summary judgment. The court granted Mr. Lewis's request and Mr. Lewis shall file any motion for summary judgment on or before August 22, 2008. No further progression order will be issued pending the ruling on the motions for summary judgment. Ten (10) working days following the court's rulings on the motions for summary judgment, the plaintiffs' counsel shall schedule and initiate a telephone conference with the court and the parties for the purpose of scheduling this matter to trial if necessary. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (Copy mailed to pro se party)(KBJ)

titleInfo.title: Matschiner et al v. Lewis et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER Plaintiffs Motion for Summary Judgment, Filing No. 20, is granted. Hartfords administrative decision to distribute RoJane Lewiss proceeds in accordance with the 1991 Designation on file is reversed. Hartford Life and Hartford Life&Accident Insurance Companys Motion for Summary Judgment, Filing No. 23, is denied. Alan Lewiss Motion for Summary Judgment, Filing No. 34, is denied. A hearing is scheduled for January 16, 2009, at 3:00 p.m. before the undersigned in Courtroom No. 3, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska. Counsel for the parties will be given the opportunity to present arguments and evidence regarding the redistribution of Alan Lewiss now divested $73,200 beneficiary interest. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (MKR) Modified on 1/6/2009 (Copies mailed)(MKR).

Counsel for the parties will be given the opportunity to present arguments and evidence regarding the redistribution of Alan Lewiss now divested $73,200 beneficiary interest. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (MKR) Modified on 1/6/2009 (Copies mailed)(MKR).

titleInfo.title: Matschiner et al v. Lewis et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Defendants' Motion for Reconsideration 50 is denied. Plaintiffs' Motion for Leave to File a Reply Brief or for Oral Argument 59 is denied as moot. Judgment is entered in the amount of $73,200 in favor of plaintiffs and against Hartford on the plaintiff's claim for benefits under defendant Hartford's ERISA plan. Hartford Life shall distribute the $73,200 equally to both plaintiffs, Katherine and Kristina Matschiner. Ten working days from the date of this order, plaintiffs' counsel shall schedule and initiate a telephone conference with Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken and the parties for the purpose of scheduling the remaining claims in plaintiffs' complaint for trial. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: Matschiner et al v. Lewis et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting in part the Plaintiff's 53 Motion for Attorney Fees. Defendant Hartford Life is ordered to pay the plaintiffs a total of $18,497.17 in attorneys fees. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (MKR)

titleInfo.title: Matschiner et al v. Lewis et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Alan L. Lewis's motion to move the trial date (Filing No. 88) is granted as set forth herein. The remaining deadlines contained in the Order Setting Final Schedule for Progression of Case (Filing No. 79) are stayed. The pretrial conference and trial are cancelled. The parties shall have ten (10) working days from the date the court rules on the pending motion for summary judgment (Filing No. 90), in which to schedule a telephone planning conference with the court, if necessary. Counsel for the plaintiffs shall contact the chambers of the undersigned magistrate judge within such time period to schedule the telephone planning conference. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (Copies mailed) (MKR)

titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER -Plaintiffs Motion to Dismiss Defendant, Hartford Life, Inc. Filing No. 104 is granted. Defendant, Hartford Life, Inc., is hereby dismissed without prejudice. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (copies mailed) (MKR)

titleInfo.title: Matschiner et al v. Lewis et al
titleInfo.subTitle: )MEMORANDUM OPINION AND ORDER - The plaintiffs' motion for summary judgment 90 is denied. On its own motion, the court certifies, under Fed. R. Civ. P. 54(b), that its order granting plaintiffs' motion for summary judgment against defendant Hartford and awarding a judgment in the amount of $73,200.00 to plaintiffs Katherine and Kristina Matschiner, tobe distributed equally, is a final judgment. In accordance with this Memorandum and Order and Fed. R. Civ. P. 58, a separate final judgment in favor of plaintiffs and against Hartford will be entered this date. All proceedings in this action are stayed pending the outcome of defendant Hartford's appeal. Defendant Lewis is ordered not to dispose of the following assets without further order of this court: a 2007 Mazda 6 sedan; a 42" television, a sofa, golf clubs and the funds in Alan Lewis's savings account at Wells Fargo Bank. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party)(KBJ

Defendant Lewis is ordered not to dispose of the following assets without further order of this court: a 2007 Mazda 6 sedan; a 42" television, a sofa, golf clubs and the funds in Alan Lewis's savings account at Wells Fargo Bank. titleInfo.title: Matschiner et al v. Lewis et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Defendant Lewis's motion to dismiss 124 is denied. Pursuant to the mandate of the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit, the judgments in favor of plaintiffs (Filing No. 62&Filing No. 107) are vacated and the plaintiffs' claims against defendant Hartford Life&Accident Insurance Company are hereby dismissed with prejudice. Status Conference set for 1/26/2011 at 3:30 PM in Courtroom 3, Federal Building, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, NE before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. A party may participate in this conference telephonically by notifying chambers (402/661-7302) at least 24 hours before the hearing of their wish to do so and the phone number where they can be reached. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (JAE)
